column1: Repalle is a town in Guntur district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. The town is one of the 12 municipalities in Guntur district and the headquarters of Repalle mandal under the administration of Tenali revenue division. It is situated near Krishna River in the Coastal Andhra region of the state.
The name Repalle is actually formed from two words: Revu (river or bank of the river) and Palle (village).  Originally known as Revupalle
column2: the name has evolved to Repalle over time.
